para.text: "The number of objects in the system."

para.style: tabstops:33px left,67px left,100px left,133px left,167px left,200px left,233px left,267px left ;
tabstops:33px left,67px left,100px left,133px left,167px left,200px left,233px left,267px left ;
tabstops:33px left,67px left,100px left,133px left,167px left,200px left,233px left,267px left ;

para.text: Use Display It (Ctrl+D) to display the count of objects in the system. There will be quite a few.

You might ask, "Why are there so many objects here already, when I haven't programmed anything yet". Well, as we mentioned on the Welcome page, everything in Smalltalk is an object and the development environment is just a world of objects all interacting with one another. So, although you may only have a single
window open there are still a lot of Smalltalk objects "beavering away" under the covers.
